Comment: The weird thing about this is how well it feeds into the guy's whole narrative and the general style of a Trump presidency. A random story like this can often be nothing, or it can turn into a force multiplier, especially in light of the last few days of stories in this particular situation, amplifying his (Hegseth's) prominence in the news cycle again and putting him right in the sights of the child that runs this circus.  I mean the fact that the conversation is actually happening is absurd. The fact that the discussion of a modern American president sacking his secretary of defense in the first three months of his presidency is actually happening, that is absurd. Kilmeade's Freudian slip is just the universe being funny, but we live in a parasitic media environment where this sort of amplification could cause all sorts of things to happen as a result.  And like, I'm not giving the administration a pass here. If they'd stop being fucking evil and awful, and the fucking Violator would stop dancing on the soul of our country, people wouldn't be writing about it. But Christ if our media apparatus doesn't love this never-ending news cycle of self-referential chaos. Like fucking piranha.

Comment: It's a hell of a situation, honestly. But the short version is that yes our Conservative leader has been using a *lot* of MAGA-adjacent rhetoric over the past couple years. Two or three months ago they would have sailed to an easy majority victory, but now it's looking like the Liberals are gonna pull off the majority instead - but like I said, I'm not counting chickens.  It's been a roller coaster.
